english: tea; tea leaves; tea plant; tea beverage

etymology.description: semantic: 艹 + phonetic: 余 (OC *la); OC reading *rlaː; modified from archaic 荼 ‘bitter plant’.
etymology.interpretation: Plant radical 艹 marks a botanical meaning, while 余 supplies the sound (reconstructed OC *la/~rlaː). Historically, the graph was adapted from 荼 ‘bitter plant’ used for tea in classical texts. The modern lower part is not related to the component in 条/條.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝绿茶(我喜歡喝綠茶)。
examples.english: I like to drink green tea.

examples.chinese: 请给我一杯茶(請給我一杯茶)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng gěi wǒ yì bēi chá.
examples.english: Please give me a cup of tea.

examples.chinese: 云南的茶很有名(雲南的茶很有名)。
examples.english: Tea from Yunnan is very famous.
